Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: oceanlvr735
Reviews.Content: Great location in a quiet part of the city. The hotel was very clean and accommodating, as well as convenient being very close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: With the Natural History and Science Museums round the corner and close proximity to Imperial College we found this the ideal place for a weekend in the capital whilst looking in on our student son. A beautifully clean, quiet and comfortable room, a homely atmosphere and friendly welcome contributed to a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant building, nice rooms with all mod cons”
Reviews.Author: Kentishmaid55
Reviews.Content: Good location, good price and helpful staff. The free Wi-Fi is very useful for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Direct view over Darwin's notebook”
Reviews.Author: Miguel A
Reviews.Content: A nice nest from where to explore the rich world of Nature loving around the Natural History Museum, what else? Clean, comfortable, staff helping and excellent (thanks, Genaro). After my daily tasks, I found a relaxing atmosphere and an enjoyable place where putting black on white my notes and thoughts. Opening my window in the morning and having a direct view over the aisles and laboratories where I have been a faithful visitor for the last 35 years is something I am thankful. I will be back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Katherine M
Reviews.Content: Had an excellant stay and will definitely visit again. Staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean and the rooms comfortable. Can't fault the location directly opposite the Science, Natural History Museum and Victoria and Albert Museum. The underground is only a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “54 Boutique is a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Diana J
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood, well situated to major museums, the Underground, restaurants, Hyde Park, etc. The hotel is tastefully appointed and well maintained; my room was comfortable and clean with a great bed and a strong, hot shower. The staff were really pleasant and helpful and the breakfast basic but sufficient. I would defintely look to stay here the next time I'm in London. The place has a generally nice and comfortable feel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent all-round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edward B
Reviews.Content: I have been staying weekly for more than 6 months and I can only say good things. The staff are excellent and the cleanliness is outstanding. It is in a wonderful location but is still peaceful enough to get a good nights sleep. I stay for Business but the amenities in the area are some of London's finest. Some rooms even have a view over the Natural History Museum. They even added new alarm clocks to every room which include an iPhone charger to save me carrying that with me each time. Big thanks to all the team for making my home away from home a place I look forward to staying.

Reviews.Title: “Szundimundi”
Reviews.Author: Diveki
Reviews.Content: Excellent place in an excellent enviroment. Calm, clean rooms, little bar inside, tv, clean shower. Its location is very convenient if somebody wants to visit the museums, parks etc. nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sean G
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an excellent location, convenient to all central London attractions. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was very spacious and comfortable and had excellent views over the Natural History Museum. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room in a great location for a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Hergos
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, rooms clean and the location was excellent all at a reasonable price. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Made very welcome”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: We were attending evening do at Royal Albert Hall. Greeted by friendly Manager who was very helpful including showing to our room a couple of hours prior to official check-in time. The room was extremely comfortable and quiet where we enjoyed a perfect nights sleep. The position for the Royal Albert Hall is unlikely to be bettered and the 3 big museums are on the doorstep. It is also very near to Kensington Palace and Hyde Park. It may not have a posh bar or restaurant but the bar is more than adequate with very reasonable prices as is the continental breakfast. Staff obliging & friendly; we had exceptional service and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalie V
Reviews.Content: We went to London to visit the Natural History Museum and stayed at fifty four boutique hotel which is literally a stones throw away. It was clean, modern and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and professional. One member of staff in particular went out of his way to offer us a different room with a view of the museum which I requested but wasn't available on our first night. Very nice continental breakfast, £7.50pp but worth it. Would definately stay here again and have already recommended to my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: warobbo
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Well equipped rooms and a brilliant location for the museums and royal albert hall.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValandNeil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to see Cirque de Soleil. Good location for Royal Albert Hall, Hyde Park,V & A and Natural History Museum. Reasonable size room for London and nicely furnished with plenty of space for clothes. Our bathroom was a bit tired but plenty of hot water and the towel rail wasn't working. We were on the 3rd floor and the lift only went to the 2nd floor so a bit tricky if you have mobility problems. Staff were helpful and courteous. Continental breakfast excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for visiting V&A and Albert Hall”
Reviews.Author: Blodwyn3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight with my Daughter for a trip to see Cirque de Soleil. Very friendly reception and bar staff. Ideally situated a short stroll from the Royal Albert Hall, Hyde Park, Natural History & V&A Museums & Harrods. There are a lot of stairs in the property so check your room location if you have mobility issues. Very comfortable bed & well equipped room. Well stocked and reasonably priced bar. We booked a double room through Booking.com for £99. We will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Aggressive and rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: AirmileAlex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Sat Dec 17th and the evening receptionist told me off very loudly for putting my do not disturb sign on the door. I had done this because of expensive photography equipment in the room. Apparently this upsets housekeeping, who entered the room regardless and moved my kit about. Average rooms, a little tired - we had a luxury room which was exactly the same as the standard one our friends inhabited. Rude staff

Reviews.Title: “Business/Personal Stay at 54 Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the 54 for 10 years for both business and pleasure, on my own, with my wife, with my wife and family, with my family and friends. Everybody loves it. The 54 is my home in London because that is exactly how I am treated, like a member of their family. I stay in hotels all over the world, and short of the Shangri La in Hong Kong, the 54 is my favourite for business and personal use. But it depends what you want in a hotel. If you want a gym, fancy restaurant, executive lounge, loyalty scheme, or any of the other trappings of the chain hotels, then look elsewhere. But I am not interested in these, nor for paying for them whether I use them or not. After 25 years of hotel life all I, and now my family, appreciate is a warm reception, a comfortable stay, a good night sleep, a shower that works, a great location, and a check in and check out experience that does not feel like queuing up at the post office at Christmas. But most of all a feeling that I am staying somewhere that I feel at home, and not a dorm with benefits. If you share these views there is no place like the 54. If they are ever booked I would rather commute (200m) than stay somewhere else. Over the decade I have stayed with the 54 I have watched a string of continuous improvements, all of which have enhanced the property without taking away the essence of a boutique hotel, and this has been good to watch, right down to this weeks security enhancements re room key operation, very innovative. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Joeorjarvis
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel on many occasions when I'm London on business and the staff are always very friendly and helpful. Great location near tube stations, Hyde park and local restaurants. If you want a no fuss, great value hotel then stay here

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: george s
Reviews.Content: what to say great location! staff are great nothing is too much trouble, rooms are good and clean. would highly recommend this hotel especially for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Poor standard in the room but was resolved satisfactorily”
Reviews.Author: malachyxxxx
Reviews.Content: For £200 i was given a basement room. It was damp and smelled terrible. I was offered an alternative room on the 4th floor with no lift beyond the 2nd and it was half the size with no discount offered. So i stayed in my basement room as i was exhausted. In the morning the skylight over the bed bleeds light quite badly so you get woken up. When you lift the blinds on the door to the terrace it is still so dark that you need to have the lights on during the day. So by the time i got to reception in the morning I was furious. £200 was a lot of money for such a sub standard offering. the manager listened to my complaints with patience and gave me a partial refund which i accepted and was happy with. He tried to state that the room was 'rentable' but i don't really think even he believed it. the rest of the hotel may be ok but no one should ever be put in a terrible damp smelling room like that. They have no food of any kind in the hotel at night and there are few shops in that area, so this is really a B&B with a bar.Please raise your standards at this place because your website and prces makes this place look better than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe, run down, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: CCLW
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 1 night. Styles itself as 'boutique', which is only true in so far as it is small. The front door is looked on arrival. I buzzed for more than 5 minutes and got nothing. Was let in by another guest exiting. The receptionist barely said hello when I got to reception. I asked if the buzzer was working, as I had been left standing outside a long time and he did not mention it. I was informed, quite rudely, that he was wokring on his own and that his job was quite stressful, even if I did not think so. The room was facing the road. SIngle-glazing meant it was quite loud, with traffic noises all night. Several things were broken, including one of the electrical sockets, which had a big hole straight into the wall with the live wires visible. While the room was fairly clean, the carpet was heavily stained and the bedding had several hairs on it. No peep holes or security chains on the doors were available, which is not great for security, espoecially as I am a woman travelling on my own. Security would also be a concern if returning late at night, as being let in took a LONG time every time. Web site advertised room service, no menu, and slippers, not available. On check-out, I asked them to order me a taxi accepting credit card payment. They asked twice if this was necessary and I confirmed. When I got to my destination, the driver had no card payment facilities. All in all, I came away feeling grimy and dissatisfied. Not a place I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: Marthaifarta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to London a few times, and the hotels in this city, is truly a lottery... We have found that when in London, we have to use around £100 a night to get an ok room. This time, that strategy paid off... The neighborhood was quiet and lovely. No shabby buildings, no exsessive garbage etc. The Glouchester Road tube station was only minutes away and a Starbucks with good service, ringht next to it. Perfect! The hotel itself was newly renovated and had a nice apperance. Staff was polite and efficiente. It was a small elevator there, if you're bags are heavy or if you did a fair bit of shopping, like me ;) The room was quite small, but had everything we needed. The bathroom was of high standard (compared to general british standard) and everything was CLEAN, which is important to me. There was a map and miscellaneous magazines, some informative of London and others typical lady magazines. We would definately stay here again, as the location was perfect for us and the standard very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Toni1234534439
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights with my girlfriend and we both liked it very much. Location is very good as told in many previous reviews (near to two underground stations, Natural History Museum, Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park etc). And when coming from Heathrow by underground, no need to change the train. Hotel has nice exterior and it is nicely decorated. Staff was very nice and helpful! Actually only major downside was the noise of the street. Because of the traffic noise I did not sleep very well (That's only reason I did not rate this 5 stars). But on the other hand my girlfriend did sleep well. She was not bothered by the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CriteriousTourist
Reviews.Content: Great location, large room (considering london standards), fair price (also considering london rates), good service. Just have to improve the break fast to pair up to the boutique hotels

Reviews.Title: “Surely only a very expensive guest house rather that a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ihp001
Reviews.Content: Very dissappointed! Good location but very average hotel (or guesthouse which would be a more appropriate description)! Very expensive for what you get which is average at best!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Johnandjoy
Reviews.Content: Was slightly concerned about booking this hotel given some of the other reviews. However, I upgraded to a deluxe room which was great! The room was spacious, clean and light. The bathroom was good too. We had a basement room that opened onto a terrace area with double doors which was an added bonus. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful and I thought it represented good value for money. If I could book this room again I would definitely stay here in the future. The only negative was the cleaner knocking on the door and entering our room at 8.00am when we were still asleep!! Otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cisp3
Reviews.Content: This is not a boutique hotel - it is a small hotel in a good location, which meets the minimum standards expected in terms of cleanliness etc. To label it as boutique is misleading as it is fairly basic and even though we had a deluxe double it did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely litle hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: PhilFiler
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are visiting the Royal Albert Hall or museums, galleries and the like in South Kensington. The hotel is on a reasonably quiet and attractive street. We had a basement room, number 4; very large, very clean and very comfortable. The quietest night sleep we have ever had in London! Staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast room/bar was a pleasant place to sit, read and relax. Breakfast was very pleasant and good value for money. There are many great places to eat locally. Overall, we think this place gives very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very well presented and value for money....perhaps!”
Reviews.Author: targetrich1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 22 on 8th July 2011. It is a double room on the front of the building. I arrived late and booked in at reception which was fuss-free. The lift only goes two floors so I had to walk a flight of stairs. The room was sparse but well presented, spacious with a large bed, safe, small tv, a selection of magazines (Grazia - eugh!) and a mini bar. The bathroom was small but clean and sufficient. The room was not noisy at night. I paid £179 for the room, which was about right. Don't expect to make life-long friends with the staff, but I didn't have any problems and would recommend it at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurreyAnon
Reviews.Content: If you really are looking for a boutique Hotel do not stay here. The rooms are decked out accordingly but there is no room service, the guy on the front desk when I arrived was not particularly friendly. I could not even borrow a 'phone charger. I expect more from a Hotel which describes itself as boutique. Iver priced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: linguistmom
Reviews.Content: I was in room 31 next to room 14, halfway between 2 floors. My room was very small and spare but clean. The bathroom was down a small flight of stairs in the room! The AC was not on/working so I slept with the window open. A bit hot and humid. The hotel staff is very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was included with my reservation and was adequate. The location is very good. A short walk to museums, shopping, Hyde Park, and the Gloucester Road Tube stop. I took the Piccadilly line all the way to Heathrow very inexpensively.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: AzMorning
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this boutique hotel. We stayed in Room 6 on the ground floor and it was lovely. A good sized bed and room with a modern feel. The breakfast was not included although it appeared to be. I didn't know until we got our bill. It was a nice breakfast but I might have gone to some of the shops near the tube stop for a change had I known. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Upstairs/downstairs”
Reviews.Author: Aberdane
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and the second time I had a basement room. This is not bad though as this hotel is based in what seems to be an old private residence from a time when there was still quarters for staff downstairs. First time I had a single room where this time I had a double room but both had the advantage of being very quiet, although small, but then this is London and I prefer peace over size! The rooms, and the hotel, seem to have been redone within the last five? years and is very nice although the carpet in the room had minor miscolour where former guests have worn shoes. The rooms I have stayed in were clean, the staff very friendly and helpful and the only negative thing is that you get a free newspaper with is dropped in front of the doors at early hours in the morning which at both stays have woken me. It is not a 5 star hotel but a very nice small quaint boutique hotel with small rooms and great location! Oh, and last time I stayed here it was with a colleague who got room 14, next to room 37 between the second and third floor... very Hogwarts! (Room numbers might not be 14%37 but 12&42 or similar).

Reviews.Title: “2nd Worst Room in London”
Reviews.Author: Meggie906
Reviews.Content: The room was approximately 64 sq feet and below ground. While I realize that the website shows the deluxe rooms, I never ever expected to be in something this small at the cost of 150 pounds per night. We asked that a cab be ordered for our return to Heathrow and that we needed a cab which takes credit card. We were assured this was taken care of at a cost of 45 pounds. When we arrived at the airport it was 65 pounds and no credit cards. We have stayed in London at least 15 times since 2001 and this was the 2nd worst experience ever. Margaret Geall Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I would really recommend”
Reviews.Author: Marieke1984
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the 54 boutique hotel in January 2011. What a lovely hotel. The location is excellent. Nearby the museum, parks and shops. Public transport is around the corner. Our room was really good. Clean and large (we had an upgrade and we stayed in the suited). The staff is wonderfull! The helped us with everything. Continental Breakfast was OK. If we are going to visit London again, we really book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster”
Reviews.Author: nosuchsoul
Reviews.Content: Good location, but the room was fairly worn down and stuffy. Dirty carpet, furniture a bit beat up and worse for the wear. Staff were not exactly rude but fairly curt and ungracious. I'm used to small and expensive in London, so while I was not expecting anything grand, I was at least hoping it would be well maintained and up to the level advertised. I would not stay here again. My friend stayed around the corner at the Radisson Edwardian, and while that was fairly standard I wish I had booked early enough to do the same (they were sold out, so I booked this place instead).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, just give the basement a miss...”
Reviews.Author: Manxmog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my mum: we asked for a twin room, and when we arrived were pleasantly surprised when the smiling, friendly young man on reception advised us he was upgrading us from a standard to a deluxe room. This turned out to be Room 1, which is below street level at the front of the hotel. One of the attractive features of 54 is the fact that the hotel is a quirky conversion from an elegant old town house. However, this does mean that the rooms are all individual in size and shape (or I assume so, from reading other reviews). Although our room was much larger than we expected, with a comfy sofa at the window end, the ceiling was quite low, and the room felt quite oppressive. A few mirrors might have helped to bounce the available light around (in addition to the full length mirror provided). During the day we were very aware of people walking past on the pavement at roughly our head height, and when we switched on the lights to relieve the gloom it felt like we were rather exposed despite the hessian-effect blind. The recessed spotlights were subtle, but unfortunately not practical for checking one's appearance in the mirror or applying makeup. A big plus was the comfy beds, and the room was spotlessly clean. I loved the proper hairdryer provided, and the flex was long enough to be able to see in the mirror. A morning newspaper was a nice touch, too. The ensuite bathroom was a good size, but the loo seat kept falling off its hinges. The shower was impressively powerful, and the perfect height for those of us vertically challenged, although I think anyone taller than say 5' 8" might have had to bend their knees a little. The bath was completely surrounded by an enclosure with a sliding door, but this made it impossible to turn on the shower to warm up unless standing in the bath, or to reach in to close the plug to run a bath. The sides of the bath were also quite high which made it a little hazardous for climbing in and out when the bath was slippy. A hook neaby on which to hang the robe provided or one's towel would have been very useful. We both liked the airy lounge/bar where breakfast is served, and the location opposite the Natural History Museum was central for exploring this part of London, but quiet enough that the street/traffic noise was not excessive at night. We did get a 7.00 am wake up, though, when someone started moving what sounded like empty bottles right outside our window. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would probably stay here again, providing we could get a room at at least street level or above. Our subterranean location is the main reason I have not given 54 top rating in all categories.

Reviews.Title: “54 Boutique Hotel - very convenient”
Reviews.Author: vattoe
Reviews.Content: Perfect location across road to Natural History Museum, 5 mins to Royal Albert Hall and Kensington/Hyde Park. Friendly staff, clean rooms and decent continental breakfast. Stayed in Rm 18 - very small (8ft x 6ft) and hot, and only one window opened, but clean and tidy, same for the small but clean bathroom. Cracked floor tile near toilet and thinnest toilet paper ever, but generally to a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: LondonJohn_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at 54 as we were attending a function at the Natural History Museum adjacent. It was clean, well presented and the room well equiped. Staff were very helpfula and we were particularly pleased that they had remembered the wheat free breakfast that we had requested. All round a good experience and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a relaxing few days away!”
Reviews.Author: manc_gal
Reviews.Content: Well where to begin?? The hotel room we were placed in was tiny demonstrated by the door opening and hitting the bed but I could live with that, however when the key gets stuck in the door and the staff struggle to yank it out I was slightly annoyed. The staff placed us in a room on the fourth floor in a much nicer room but having to haul our luggage, iron and ironing board (we earlier asked for) up four flight of stairs and no assistance offered was not the great start to our trip. After that the iron didnt work and leaked everywhere, the other iron they brought up worked for 5mins then also didn't work, the hairdryer in the room didn't work and it was all topped off by our Saturday lie-in ruined twice by the fire alarm at 8.30AM because someone was apparently having a shower (according to reception when we rang down)!! It's only saving grace....location - my advice, look for a better hotel in the same area as the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: MatthewParrish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I originally stayed here back in 2007 when we visited London from Melbourne and we enjoyed it so much we decided to stay there again when we came back to London again recently. We were delighted to find that the hotel still retains the ssame level of cleanliness, good customer service and general ambience that made it such a delight in the first place. The location is fantastic - close to Knightsbridge and the Kings Road and across the road from the Natural History Museum. Throw in the great local restaurants of South Kensington and it really is a fantastic package! We would genuinely not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Abside24
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, went to London for 3 nights and this hotel was a pleasant surprise. I booked this hotel via their website and got a great deal so was not sure what to expect with such a cheap rate. The hotel is really close to both Gloucester rd and Sth Kensington tube stations so it was nice to only have to walk a short distance with our suitcases and the neighborhood is very safe. When we arrived we were excited before even entering the hotel, it has a lovely exterior and is directly across the road from the Natural History museum. Our room was on the top floor and had an amazing view of the museum. This hotel is 5 star, the staff were very nice and helpful and always had a smile to greet us when we came in. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: HOBKent
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because of its location, being so close to The Albert Hall. However after reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive to say the least. I had no need to worry at all and think some of the negative reviews are way too harsh. The hotel is as it says on the website a small boutique hotel in an absolutely perfect location. You are in walking distance of some great sites. We were given room 10 on the 1st floor which was a decent size and very nicely decorated. I personally thought the hotel had a lovely feel about it. The bar/ breakfast room was intimate and the continental breakfast was again very nice. A special thanks to Akram who was on the desk when we checked in, he really could not have been more helpful and made our stay there a memorable one. We would certainly return and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: B0
Reviews.Content: 54 was easy to find. Just walked out of either Gloucester Road or South Ken tube station and head towards Imperial College and the National History Museum. It is one of the houses opposite the road from the Museum's ice skating rink. There are running numbers on the pillars so you cannot miss it. I had a good stay at 54. No doubt about it. The location was fab. Easy access to the Tube. Near the major museums. Near a few eating places and more importantly, offering all that while not having to put up with the noise & crowds associated with Piccadily Circus, Leicester Sq or Oxford Circus hotels. Overall, the decor was simple but tasteful. I was a little surprised to see that the reception / check in counter was exactly that - a counter or a hole in the wall, merged with a small bar counter in an equally compact breakfast area. Compact is a good word to use to describe the hotel. It is obvious that the hotel was converted from a residential property - so the living room become a breakfast area / bar and various bedrooms became hotel rooms of different configuration and size. We were given a free upgrade to a deluxe room on the top floor - possibly b'cos we were staying for a few nights and there weren't many other people in the hotel due to the uncharacteristic arctic weather in London. The room (Room 24, 4th floor) was quite large by London standards and was pleasantly decorated. Nothing too fancy or over the top. Just what you would expect from a decent business or boutique hotel. I even had a view of the National History Museum and Imperial College & despite the room facing Queens Gate road, there was hardly any traffic noise. The room, especially the bathroom was a little cool but not too cold - I have stayed at other hotels where the room was warm but the bathroom was freezing. One thing to note though. The lift only goes up to the 2nd floor. So any room from nos 19 onwards would have to be accessed via a flight of stairs. Rooms 22 to 26 were accessed by yet another flight of windy (small) stairs. Also, certain rooms are along the small corridor where you can hardly walk 2 abreast e.g. room 18 or 19, so I expect those rooms to have to put up with noise from footsteps on creaky wooden floorboards. Staff seemed to be uniformly non-British and mostly fairly young. The housekeeping staff were, we suspect, nearly all E. European ladies while the reception, save that one middle-aged man in the day - were all men in their late twenties or early thirties. Mostly quite friendly, especially the chap who did the night shift. Lots of smiles and was very patient. My only wee grouse was that one young chap who did the day shift who was not very conversant, very matter-of-fact but he was nonetheless, professional and was quick with his responses. We had a good chat with the middle-aged chap at breakfast about the cold weather - he advised us to wrap up warm. Breakfast was continental. Croissants and 2 kinds of each of the following : ham, cheese, toast (white & multi-grain), yogurt, pastries and fruit. There was 3 kinds of boxed cereal but only 1 kind of milk (semi-skimmed) and 1 kind of juice (orange). So, its nothing to crow about but something light to start your day. I found the hotel rates very reasonable for what I got, albeit I did get a good promotional rate. Given the choice of the Radisson Edwardian, Millennium and other hotels in the area, I would still pick 54 the next time....

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, quiet, comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CLH53
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to avoid the large impersonal hotels with shoe boxes for rooms and it certainly delivered. Our room was plenty big enough with a door opening onto a private decked area and, apart from our own, the bed was the most comfy I've slept in. Everything was spotlessly clean. The location was perfect for us, being within an easy walk of the Natural History, Science and V & A Museums and only a little further to South Kensington Tube Station. The staff were helpful, dealing with any requests promtly & politely. We stayed for three nights and I returned home relaxed and refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Ho hum - not exactly boutique.”
Reviews.Author: Sithers
Reviews.Content: Interesting combination this one. Can't help but feel that I lower my standards in London - it's like that becomes a mantra for excusing mediocrity. Front of house was helpful but not particularly welcoming - I really felt I'd intruded. However, he was helpful in moving me from a cold room to a bigger cold room. First room was a standard double - some evidence of "boutification" but not exactly extensive. Bathroom was pretty old, and the only chair / stool was made of a colour of leather popular in the 70's. Overall the room was pretty small, but reasonably clean. However the radiator didn't work. Desk guy helped by moving me to the lower ground floor (cellar I guess) - to a "junior suite". Bigger, radiators still not working and same average bathroom and trippy 70's furniture. Much bigger as well. Almost big enough to justify the large skylight directly over the bed with only a wonkey bamboo blind to keep out daylight. Thank god it's deepest winter - you'd be up with the dawn chorus in summer. One robe supplied. "fluffy towels" mentioned on the web site were white towels. Not exactly luxry. Standard dismal Gilchrist and Somes bath stuff for the standard bath. So - I've stayed in worse hotels, and I've stayed in far better in London. I think it's the use of the word "boutique" in the hotel name that should be both a warning and an expectation setter. If you're expecting top notch goose-down bedding, Villroy and Bosch ceramics, and designer toiletries that the term usually conjours up, then this will be a disapointment. I guess they have to tell you it's a boutique hotel, because there's no way you'd know otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Wellcomming”
Reviews.Author: Soderdrottning
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mother to London just for the weekend and found 54 Boutique Hotel on the internet. It looked very nice on their website and decide to try it. It was a nice surprise: clean and fresh, no smells, friendly staff (besides the young blond guy), our bedroom faced the interior patio which was very silenced... Very happy with the hotel and I strongly recommend it! A tip: Eat your breakfast somewhere else since it was a bit too simple: no choice of bread, not so many pastries, no choices of teas and other small things. I still think that the hotels should offer Wifi for free (I had to pay 3£ for 24h...).

Reviews.Title: “Awful little room with a dreadful front desk manager”
Reviews.Author: LinZPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: The room #14 was a tiny room, like a closet; bathroom walls had mold and mildew. Shower stall was tiny. I asked to change to a larger room (there was no other) and then was told I had to honor my two night stay. After several attempts at requesting that the desk manager (who was offensive) to reconsider the policy because I was uncomfortable staying there, the guy finally allowed me to cancel the 2nd night...Perhaps it was after I told him I was going to share my experience on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Please can we have more light!”
Reviews.Author: flowerlady64
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights at this hotel and it wouldn't have taken much more care by management for us to give it five stars. We asked for a quiet room and were given what was described as the quietest room in the hotel. This room was right at the top of the hotel at the back and was very quiet but be aware the lift only goes to the second floor and there are two more steep, quite long flights of stairs up to the room. The room had plenty of hanging space, shelves and drawers, a safe, tea/coffee making facilities (althought we had to leave a request for milk), fridge with 2 complimentary bottles of water and small TV with few channels. The bed was large (we think it was two singles pushed together) but was very comfortable. The heat was unbearable but luckily the radiator could be turned off and the window opened. The bathroom tiles had a slight mould issue and, as seems to be usual with London hotels, only 1 seat in the room - a sort of leather stool. The staff were friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast was nice. Situated on a leafy street opposite the museums, close to Tube, small shops and restaurants. Our only real gripe was the lack of lighting in the room. The very small reading lights by the bed were only suitable for reading in bed, the ceiling light at he bottom of the bed didn't work and the angle-poise lamp on the desk didn't work either! We reported these lights but they weren't fixed. It was dingey in the room which marred what would otherwise have been a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: ktee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and it was great. We were welcomed warmly, but not shown to our room, which was small but clean and tidy. The bathroom was also clean, although a few tiles needed replacing and the towels could have been a bit newer. The bed was comfy and we slept soundly, being able to have the window open (it was very hot as the heating was on full) and not a sound could be heard outside. Breakfast was a relaxed continental buffet which was ok. The hotel itself is well placed with the Natural History Museum opposite, plenty of small shops, bars and restaurants and the tube a few minutes walk away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, friendly hotel in the beautiful area of South Kensington”
Reviews.Author: Hendennapier
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed two memorable days in an area of London which we know well, and love. The Boutique Hotel was ideally placed, and from our bedroom window we could watch the horses going by, in leafy Queen's Gate, on their way to morning exercise in Hyde Park. The staff were friendly, and responded to a very small complaint we had on our arrival with alacrity, and great generosity. We are most grateful for the welcome and attention we received, and hope to return on some future occasion.

Reviews.Title: “everything you need after a long exhausting day”
Reviews.Author: reisgraag
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet. I like smaller hotels anyway. The people were very nice and helpful, the rooms were neat, tidy. I slept very well. I recommend this to anyone. Also Kensington is a good area to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top class personal service!”
Reviews.Author: Wilja
Reviews.Content: NIce little hotel with brilliant personal service from the helpful staff. Travelled with my 74 years old mother. Peaceful, clean hotel with a warm family feeling. Very nice room with a fresch feeling and with a good location. Really served value for that price! Lousie from Sweden

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, perfect location, very comfortable beds and pillows”
Reviews.Author: stockhillbarks
Reviews.Content: Travelling without my husband with my 10 year old daughter it was important for us to stay in a safe area. Hotel 54 is well located for attractions (Natural History Museum, Science Musuem, Hyde Park, Royal Albert Hall etc) and surprisingly quiet at night. There are restaurants and shops within a 10min walk, so evening meals are easy to find. The informal continental breakfast worked well for us. The room was very comfortable, (the beds and squashy pillows were amazing) clean and had a nice small terrace which gave us some outside space. The staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble.(This was reflected when nothing was said when I reported a problem with a bedside lamp, there was no problem, the lamp is a touch operated one and I hadn't quite worked it out! The person on duty simply told me the matter had been rectified) There were a few staff changes during our visit and they were all very pleasant and helpful, so it would seem that this is standard service. When I was checking hotels and prices before my visit, this hotel compared very well on price, and although it is a chain it has a more personal feel. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends who are planning a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Aqua_swee
Reviews.Content: Would like to share a great story of excellent customer service I received from this hotel, or more accurately, led by the GM James Menhinik 3 weeks before we arrived, realized that I made a terrible mistake- I entered the date wrongly! Called the hotel but the front desk told me that they could not do anything. It has to be treated as a cancellation and rebooking. The rules and regulations were all spelled out clearly on the website. More importantly, the hotel was "full" for one of the nights and this request was not possible. Not letting up. I remembered how the GM would personally reply to comments posted on Trip Advisor. I wrote directly to him. It was my last straw. Viola! He replied within the day. Found ways of rearranging some internal "blocking" of the room due to renovation work. He went out of his way to help! We stayed there for two nights. Was upgraded to a higher room so that a third bed could be placed comfortably for my daughter. We were very happy about this hotel. The room was spacious, the location excellent, the staff were friendly. What else could one ask for? I can only say that for a hotel to be under such exemplary leadership of a GM, it can't go too wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, comfy beds, quiet”
Reviews.Author: jokerman101
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel in Kensington, right beside the Natural History and Science museums, V&A, Albert Hall, Hyde Park. 5 minute walk from either the Gloucester Rd or South Kensington tube stations. Outstanding location for a base to explore London. We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed it immensely, staff were lovely, except for one dope on the second morning who was completely useless at manning the breakfast (hence why I'm only giving 4 stars instead of 5). The rooms are a little small, but the bed was very comfortable and the shower was terrific. We had a downstairs room at the back which was very quiet and private. The place was spotless. Overall highly recommended, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family”
Reviews.Author: teenagerm0m
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage sons and I stayed for 5 nights. The accomodations were great. We had all the ammenities we could need. The breakfast was good and very convenient to make for an early outing of sightseeing. The best part was the staff. They were VERY helpful and friendly. They showed us places on maps, gave helpful suggestions and tips, got us ice whenever we needed it, and talked with us. They really helped to take this hotel from nice and clean to a really great place. I would hopefully stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Paultaylor85
Reviews.Content: I've been staying with 54 Boutique Hotel for a number of years now and each time I go back there's always a warm welcome. The staff are very friendly and most accomodating, the facilities are well presented, clean and nicely decorated and the atmosphere relaxing. The rooms are very comfortable and even the smaller ones provide a pleasant retreat after a days business or exploration of the capital. The surrounding area is splendid, with many options for fine dining at reasonable prices nearby and good transport links. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Birthday Present!”
Reviews.Author: vixiepoo1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a few nights as a birthday treat, and this is an absolutely gorgeous hotel! We got it through lastminute.com as one of the "Top Secret Hotels" so we actually got it for much cheaper than they would charge if we had booked with them directly (tip for you guys)! The man on reception was very friendly, and even showed us to different rooms to let us choose which one we wanted! (one was right next to reception and the other was on the top floor - we chose the top floor!) The lift at the hotel only goes up to the second-from-top floor and there's another flight to climb after that, but it's only small. The room itself was gorgeous; very comfy bed, lovely clean and soft bedding, and a nice size room with a clean-ensuite bathroom (shower only, but powerful). Has it's own hairdryer, and tea/coffee making facilities, and a TV etc. The bar area is very nice, and on one of the nights we were the only ones in there and the staff were great company (even if the drinks were a little pricey!) In my opinon, the only downside was that breakfast (continental) was served in this room as well, so there were no tables to sit at and it felt a little strange. But then again, it was nice to sit on a big leather sofa with a cup of tea watching the news on a plasma TV (even if it was a struggle to eat the cereal). Also, for an extra small charge, you can heave breakfast in bed! That was a lovely treat! The location is great too; as we stayed right ontop of Christmas there was an ice-rink at the Natural History Museum, which is only about 5 minutes walk away. If you fancy a (naughty) mightnight snack, there are some takeaways about the same distance as well! Plenty of restaurants nearby as well if you head towards the direction of Natural History Museum. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here. We'd definately go again providing we get it through lastminute.com, as I don't think we could afford the full price!

Reviews.Title: “Not Boutique at all !!!”
Reviews.Author: JoyceYF
Reviews.Content: Boutique is terribly misleading. It's a small hotel in a good location for V & A. That's all. My single room was pokey. The bathroom was slightly mildewy. I was at the back of the hotel, off the turn of the stairs. Traffic noise was nil. BUT the noise from within the hotel was bad. Banging doors and turning keys ! Don't be mislead by the name 54 BOUTIQUE. Not all the services described to be available applies to single rooms. eg. no fridge in a single.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give a better review I had actually got the room I booked”
Reviews.Author: dde0apb
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here with Travel Republic, received a confirmation from the agent, and then emailed the hotel to check that they had my booking, which they said they did. But when I arrived I found that they were in fact full and had bunmped me to a rather less pleasant place around the corner. They were very apologetic, but I asked how they could so this when they had confirmed my booking. Basically they had always been full and they were hoping someone would drop out, but no-one did. It's a bugger finding this out at 10.30 at night at the end of a long day and before another long day. To be fair they did pay for my alternative accommodation, and refunded my original booking, so I suppose I got a free night in London. But actually I would rather have paid for the booking I made and stayed in what I hoped would be a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: janeymaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on 1st June, and found it to be very nice. Great location, friendly staff and comfortable room - all in all very good value for London. We would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “We spent one night here after attending a...”
Reviews.Author: Apsie73
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after attending a wedding reception at the Natural History Museum. The service was excellent and very helpful. I had called the day before to ask if we could check in early as we had to be at the wedding and our room was ready for us when we arrived. The room was clean and nicely set up, we had a little terrace. The continental breakfast was excellent and the bar / breakfast room was lovely and relaxing. The only fault we could find was the pillows were very soft and floppy and the shower was more powerful than the shower screen could cope with, leading to a slightly damp bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Customer-oriented service!”
Reviews.Author: heliantus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located and the atmosphere is very nice, it makes you feel at home. Personnel is kind and really customer-oriented, something which in big capitals is not frequent...

Reviews.Title: “quiet and private and charming”
Reviews.Author: marathonmanNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 days during the London Marathon. I had stayed at the hotel 5 years ago before it was renovated. My stay this time around was what i was looking for: 1) quiet, 2) close to tube 3) and the single room was as expected from the pictures, The only negative was the light on the desk did not work and there was no WiFI in the room and i could have used a tub to soak in after the marathon. I was told that they were working on it so that the next time i visit, i should have assess to the internet while i am in my room. The staff was very cordial: Next time i will book a double room but overall , i will stay at this quiet and private and cahrming hotel again when in London.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Bafama
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the hotel. In every aspect absolutely recommendable. Very friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable room, ideal location for discovering london. Tube station close by, pubs, cafes etc. too. Very good if u don't want to be in the packed centre but just around the corner in a nice and relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New London Base”
Reviews.Author: Tag2267
Reviews.Content: Two night booking late March 2010. This is a classy hotel that is affordable and well located being in walking distance to the Tube, on the doorstep of the Natural History Museum and minutes from Regents Park. The Hotel is spotlessly clean, staff attentive and the breakfast was great in so far as continental breakfasts go. Just wish they could make a good coffee…. Rooms are of an adequate size for an older European hotel (albeit small from a US/AUS perspective) and well appointed. If you want a Hilton or similar go there. If you want a classy and authentic hotel in the centre of London I strongly recommend this hotel. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Just loved this hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: SkillyB
Reviews.Content: My husband Paul and myself booked this hotel for an overnight stay to visit the Van Gogh exhibition. We had a wonderful overnight stay, with a surprise free room upgrade on arrival. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The hotel was clean and welcoming. The breakfast was lovely. Perfect location for sightseeing, we walked miles and got some fabulous photographs. Right next door to the Natural History Museum and the V & A. Close by Kensington Gardens and the Albert Hall. Newspapers were even left outside our room in the morning. We will be returning to this trustworthy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sharonGalway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in the last 2 months. The first time I was on my own and in London for business. I had a lovely room, just behind reception, and could not have been made more welcome. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and I was very happy with my stay. A month later I returned with my husband for a weekend in London. We were in a slightly bigger room, again on the ground floor. Again I was impressed with the standard and cleanliness of the room. They guys at reception were helpful and friendly, and even accommodated our late breakfast on our last morning. I would certainly recommend this hotel to a friend, and intent to return if I ever find myself in London again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Rooonan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night when we went to a show at the Royal Albert Hall - only 5-10 mins walk away. Hotel was clean, modern and room had everything we needed. Staff were friendly and upgraded our room to a delux, with a good view of the Natural History Museum! Hotel doesn't have its own kitchen so breakfast was just continental but this suited us fine. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “cute boutique hotel, some problems”
Reviews.Author: jsoko22
Reviews.Content: things to know: 1) you need to buzz in to get into the hotel and sometimes it takes a while for the guy to come open the door for you after you buzz 2) the breakfast was really good 3) the rooms REALLY vary in quality. we stayed in 3 different rooms during the course of our stay. first was huge, but in basement, and a/c made obnoxious noises. second was cute, smaller, had a little porch that was shared with another room. third was nice, bigger, no porch, but hard to get to (take elevator to 2nd floor then walk down some steps then walk up a flight of steps.. that's the only way to get there) basically if you don't like your room ask for a different one and you might like it a lot more since they vary in quality/size so much. 4) pretty close to the tube, and in a nice area. South Ken is beautiful but pretty empty at night so be aware that walking back from the tube at night you might be one of not many people on the street. Still, never felt unsafe. 5) Just a tip to know, if you can book your cab to/from airport online it's better than booking through hotels. The hotels all rip you off and charge like 50 pounds. Online you can find nice limo services for as little as 20 pounds! 6) There is wi-fi at this hotel but there is no computer to use so y ou need to bring your laptop or your iphone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...great area of London”
Reviews.Author: AndrewsD
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to London in October 2009. We booked this hotel blindly, and I was a little concerned, not beibg familiar with the hotels in this area. (Chelsea). I was pleased to find this quaint , but very modern boutique hotel on Queensgate. Very nice room;clean and excellent service. Breakfast and bar available on the premises. Walking distance to museums, Kensington Palace and Gloucester Rd. tube stop. Personel at the hotel were very friendly and helpful..and available 24 hours. I would definitely choose this hotel again, when in London.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped Out of Hotel After They Took Our Bags!”
Reviews.Author: MeekoBrighton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were allocated this hotel by lastminute.com as a "secret hotel". We booked 2 nights with Continental Breakfast and paid £200 up front 6 weeks prior to arrival on 30/05/09 and received our online Booking Confirmation. We arrived at about 1:15pm, confirmed that we had a 2 night booking, but were told that our room would not be available until after 3pm (fair enough), but that we were welcome to leave our suitcases. I offered to do the paperwork, but was told that would not be possible. I left my bags with reception and told them I would be back later. We did not return until about 9.30pm only to be told that there was no reservation for us for that night, but that the hotel management had arranged alternative accomodation for us in another hotel, which necessitated us taking a taxi (which they paid for). We ended up staying the night in the other hotel (I dont even recall the name of it) and then the following moring we had to return to our original hotel but still could not occupy our room until after 3pm. All in all I would say that the Boutique Hotel is run like a shambles. Yes, they were made hollow apologies for the problem and yes they allegedly gave us their "best room" for our second night, but we were turfed out of the hotel on the first night without any explanation. We didn't even get offered a complimentary drink as an apology. The hotel is in an excellent location close to the Royal Albert Hall and Hyde park, but there are loads of other hotels in this area so in order to avoid disappointment i recommend you look for an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for stay in Kensington.”
Reviews.Author: wd50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights whilst on a trip to see Clapton at the RAH. It's ideally placed - just a 5 minute walk away. Restaurants and pubs are just a 5 minute walk away in Kensington. All staff encountered were friendly and helpful even letting us leave our luggage there after we'd checked out so we could do a bit of shopping unencumbered (Harrods 15 minutes walk). Our standard double was well appointed and whilst it was small it was large enough. Room was too hot but then we discovered the air conditioning! Absolutely no noise through the huge sash window which we were able to leave open at night (our room was at the back). Woken up at 5.30am by corridor firedoor closing several times. Next morning, when we mentioned this to the staff they apologised and explained it was some late returning guests who weren't staying a second night. They offered to move us but we stayed put and the second night was fine. Superb shower (always important) and generous breakfast. The duty manager was great as a tourist information resource - best tube station, directions, buses etc. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite business hotel”
Reviews.Author: andaid
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel, the staff make you feel like it is a home from home and I look forward to when I stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Franca2010
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect from the hotel so it was a nice surprise. For a standard room, it was quite big taking into account other hotels in London. Bed is very good, shower is great and staff is friendly. we asked for a late check out and had no problems with that. for people who appreciates small details, you have daily newspaper and maganizes. Only two minus: some small spots in the decorative cushions and a very small tv, if you need to read legends, it's a problem. We had a very good experience and we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “A good contemporary style hotel near to the Natural History Museum”
Reviews.Author: aeb67
Reviews.Content: A very good stopover on our way to Spain by train. It is a modern hotel with comfortable beds, and a smart bathroom. We did not have a view from our back room but it was very quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is very near to The Natural History Museum and restaurants. The breakfast was very good and plentiful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... Not good”
Reviews.Author: B0DAI
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were going to Cirque Du Soleil at the Royal Albert Hall, and so location was a key factor (especially as it was particularly cold that weekend!!) So based on location, this hotel was perfect... it was literally just around the corner from the Albert Hall. We were put into a room on the 4th floor (the lift only operated for the first 2 floors) and I must say that from the photos on their website, I was shocked at how small the room was! There was a lot of noise coming through from the room next door, which I think was actually somebody's flat, so not the fault of the hotel. The bar was very pleasant, but massively over-priced (not really a surprise though considerring the location of the hotel) Over all, I would say that our stay at the hotel was good, but you could certainly find a LOT better for the money they charged!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Canadianchickuk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful weekend away in this hotel. After being delayed for 3 hrs at the airport and then having to take a replacement bus after the Stanstead Express was cancelled. Though initially google directed me the wrong way to the hotel once the hotel was found it was bliss. The room was not the largest room but was still better then some accommodation I have stayed in in london. The bed was so comfortable that we managed to sleep in both mornings. The staff were extremely helpful and always had a smile for us. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to London

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Cat1082
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable room, and the bathroom was huge (and very clean too). The staff were friendly and helpful, offering services such as arranging an iron in the room before arrival. breakfast was nice too. Only problem is that the fire alarms are sensitive to steam (from the shower) and we were woken at midnight by the alarm! It was quickly sorted though and didn't marr our stay. Very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a base”
Reviews.Author: Rodsussexuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights as a short break in London with some friends. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel doesnt try to be what it isnt and the reception staff were excellent. Very friendly, keen to engage with you and polite - certainly not givens in London! The rooms were basic but perfectly adequate. The beds are firm and the bathrooms small but totally functional apart from the lack of tea and coffee making facilities. For a hotel in London, the room was very quiet. Breakfast is continental only which was a bit disappointing and the arrangments are a bit limited. There are only two tables and if they are taken then you have to sit on the sofas which isnt all that comfortable. The location is great depending on what you want to do. For museums it is good, for nightlife not so good. We wanted the former so no problems for us. Only one other area for improvement I think. There is only one person on duty in reception and they also service the bar and the entrance to the hotel (which is by intercom). This is over-stretching them a little I think but their attitude was fantastic despite this. The bar didnt have any lemon for drinks which was a bit surprising but not catastrophic either! All in all a good experience. We would use the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Stylish.”
Reviews.Author: Chalister
Reviews.Content: Researching London hotels, I found many at less than £100, which looked awful, and many at £350, which was too expensive. However, this is one of the few in the middle price range. It was clean and neat. The walls are pale grey, and there are no patterns anywhere - a good thing, as I think that all the rooms are small. The hotel is in a side street, and our room looked out on to the trees in the grounds of the Natural History Museum, which was nice. It was also quieter than being on the main road. We went to the Royal Albert Hall, which took us 10 mins. walking slowly up the hill. It was very convenient for that, and there is also a tube nearby. However, there were no cafes close, although if you walk towards Knightsbridge there are several. The OxfordTube bus stops in Notting Hill, and it is a pleasant walk accross the park to Queensgate.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: chetpoll
Reviews.Content: Small, resembling a pansion, hotel next to the Natural History Museum. The small deluxe double room had a terrace, which is fantastic when you are a smoker but, looks at a dull white wall which could better exploited by the hotel, for instance some plants or whatever to reduce stimulation of claustrophoebic feelings. The bathroom was excellent. The third bed promised by the hotel was there but was meant to serve a kid and not a third adult as it was explicitly and prior to the deal agreed- ... Breakfast must have been very dull, though included in the price we prefered going out and have some.( By the way I noticed that it was served on the buffet from 6 o' clock in the morning whereas the hotel was serving it after 08:00, meaning how these poor croissants could be fresh, hot and crispy if you decided to have them at, let's say 09:00?). Nothing to dine in the room, poor mini bar and as a conclusion, not a boutique hotel but a small, decent one with very polite people at the desk front and, sorry to tell this, lousy decoration especially in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “dont do it”
Reviews.Author: mckees
Reviews.Content: awful....small, small room for 3 of us...we had a double room with a cot...cot was unusable...room was barely able to hold us...beds were terrible...bathroom was great but they should have spent more on the beds...had to walk up 2 flights of steps...no lift after floor 2 we were on the 4th...no internet, no phone book to make other hotel reservations, poor location...would be good for young backpackers maybe...I guess you get what you pay for...definitely not a recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small,intimate Hotel. Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: doolally_w7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times in the past. We both like the location and the Hotel. Excellent base for the museums, (out the front door, cross the road and you're there). OK, the Hotel is not enormous, but because of this, the service is much more personal. The Manager, a guy called James is thoroughly charming and his team couldn't do enough for us. The breakfast is simple, no heart clogging English Breakfast, which was great. The room we had (at the front) was lovely. Admittedly not the biggest room, but spotless and very well maintained. My only issue? The Minibar. Placed in a corner, did someone steal the cabinet it should fit in? Overall, a great place with a good location and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “good job i didn't pack a cat”
Reviews.Author: liz78cheshire
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at your hotel on 28th May I was hugely disappointed. The rooms dispite looking fabulously spacious on the website, was in my case, not big enough to swing a cat. I booked through laterooms so I wouldn't have expected the best room but they had a fair amount of availability that night according to reception I would have thought it possible to have a better room. I also requested outdoor space if at all possible but it appears that was not the case. The wine list is great but to charge about £9 for a glass of Chablis and then to serve it at little under room temperature was far from ideal. It's such a shame the experience I had doesn't live up to image portrayed on the well thought out website.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water!!”
Reviews.Author: Magana
Reviews.Content: London: Fiftyfour Boutique Hotel: "I will not return!" I have just returned from a Weekend at the fiftyfour boutique hotel. The hotel propaganda says: (The hotel lies between Knightsbridge and the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea. Fifty-Four Boutique Hotel is a traditional London town house with its own special qualities. Our guests find a quiet sanctuary from the bustle of London where they can relax in comfort.) My room (room 20) was cosy and featured a decked terrace...The first impression was magnificent... The air-conditioning was noisy, and the "modern ensuite bathroom", as they advertise, did not have Hot Water! Why go back to this Hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Not quite "boutique", but has all the basics”
Reviews.Author: inLdn
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets the minimum standards expected in terms of cleanliness etc., however, I do not think it is exceptional enough to be labelled a "boutique hotel." The good things about the hotel are: great location, clean rooms, helpful conceirge. As I arrived on a very early morning flight and arrived at the hotel around 7am I was allowed to check in to my hotel right away. Based on the other reviews, I would say that the rooms at Fifty Four probably vary somewhat. I had a single room which was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: SVAB
Reviews.Content: If you wish to be in the Queen's Gate area of London, this is a charming Hotel I would highly recommend. The double room I stayed was immaculately clean with high ceiling. The air conditionig purred quietly. I had a very comfortable night. The continental buffet style breakfast had a good selection and the large coissant I had tasted fresh and delicious. I was as usual in a hurry while packing and left my Ipod Nano in the safe. Only when I arrived home late in the afternoon that I noticed I have left it. I immediatley rang the hotel and was told that it was not found but as the room was already occupied, they will search the next day. My husband receive a phone call the following day and was informed that the Ipod was located and handed in. He asked them to post it to us and giving details of our credit card to pay for the postage. My Ipod is now returned undamaged and I wish to commend 54 Boutique Hotel for its extra help in this matter.

Reviews.Title: “Tries Hard but results disappointing”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: Fifty Four Boutique Hotel is situated about ten minutes walk from Gloucester Road or South Kensington Tubes, close to the museum district and Imperial College. It is a large converted regency terrace property with a lot of stairs - not ideal for guests with limited mobility although there is a lift to some floors. Boutique really describes the limited service rather than the decor. The rooms tend towards spartan rather than minimalist and the decor sits uncomfortably with the period property. It would be hard to use them as a base for a business visit - the desk space is not adequate for working at. The rooms are clean enough and the staff conspicuously friendly and efficient. There is no restaurant but a reasonable continental breakfast is included and served in the downstairs room that doubles as a bar and a lounge. Basically, this establishment comes close to being serviced rooms rather a hotel as conventionally understood. There is nothing wrong with this and the rates reflect the service offered but guests might be disappointed if they expected the quality of environment and pampering that goes with other 'boutique' hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoneypennyEngland
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 night business trip to London and spent 4 very comfortable nights at 54 Boutique Hotel in South Kensington. I had to book a hotel at short notice with a budget of just £120.00 per night which proved quite difficult in central London. I found the hotel through Last Minute or Late Rooms but actually got a cheaper room by booking direct with the hotel. Admittedly my single room was tiny with the smallest shower cubicle I have ever come across and yet there was something charming about staying here. The accommodation was clean and modern and, as a single female traveller, I felt exceptionally safe. The staff are all really helpful and courteous which added to my nice experience. There is a bar/breakfast room and although no kettle in my room the staff were always happy to give me fresh pots of hot water and a cup and saucer to take back to my room to make tea. There is no restaurant but the deliverance service (hot food to order delivered to the hotel) is absolutely fine and pretty reasonably priced. I always ate mine in the bar which didn't bother the staff at all - in fact they provided me with plates, knives and forks and napkins each evening for this. The hotel is no more than a 5 minute walk to Gloucester Road underground and right opposite the Natural History Museum. It's an upmarket location and I would readily recommend a stay here for business or pleasure. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for leisure, not business.”
Reviews.Author: kfrench
Reviews.Content: First, I should begin with the positive as there were some things that were great at the hotel. The location was terrific and great for walking to Hyde Park, museums and the tube. The staff was very friendly and seemed to know who you were. I had a colleague call and they were able to let him know I had left one hour prior. The rooms were spacious and the bath was newly remodeled and very nice. The complimentary breakfast was a great way to begin the day and spared me from uneeded expenses. There were a few negative aspects of my stay too. They do not have alarm clocks in the rooms and offer wake up calls. I did not receive 2 of them! They write them on a sheet next to your room, but if they are tending to another issue it is easy for them to forget. One of the issues that needed attending to was the fire alarm. The alarm is easily set off by steamy showers. The alarm goes of when fellow patrons fail to read the sign in the bathroom and leave the door open. This happened several times at 11:30 pm and 6:30 am! The rooms are also very noises and you hear ever foot step and bathroom noise of other rooms. As I stated in my title, these would have been mildly amusing (if I had been on holiday), but were a huge source of stress during my business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value for central London.”
Reviews.Author: LFrancis
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a standard double room directly with the hotel at a very reasonable £119 including breakfast. The situation was perfect on a quiet street in Kensington, seconds away from the Natural History and V&A museums. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite (number 4) which although did not have an outside view was extremely spacious with very clean modern furnishings. We did not drink in the bar but ordered wine and coffees in our room which was delivered quickly and courteously. When we arrived back from the theatre at 11pm there were still several people in the bar area so it was not lacking in atmosphere like some small hotels. An added bonus was that we were able to park right outside, rare in central London! Breakfast was continental with nice coffee and an OK selection of the normal fare although it did state on the menu to ask for other options. There is no restaurant on site but food can be ordered in for you from the 'Deliverance' service. Overall an excellent value, modern hotel with very good staff. We will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: RisqueUk
Reviews.Content: The standard of accommodation is well below that can be achieved elsewhere in London. The rooms are so small that the furniture is made to measure to fit the rooms. Check the floor area before booking. Breakfast is served in the bar area and you will be lucky to get a seat to enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne7759
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night in this hotel on 15 June 2007. We booked through a hotel website and were quoted £139 for the standard double room inclusive of continental breakfast. We must admit that some of the comments read on the Tripadvisor reviews did put some doubt as to whether we had done the right thing, but we were pleasantly surprised, and had a very comfortable and agreable stay. We travelled to the hotel by tube, alighting at Gloucester Road station. We timed our walk to the hotel to be exactly 6 minutes walking at a gentle pace, with bags to carry. We fail to understand the comments about the long distance of this hotel from the tube station! Upon arrival, we were given a choice of a smaller room facing the rear on a lower floor, or a larger room on the 4th floor facing the road. We chose the latter, and were not disappointed. There is a small lift to the second floor only, and you have two flights of stairs to the top. Unless you were serious disabled, in which case the point would be valid, we failed to see how this was a problem to some...But if this is an issue, then best to request a room up to the second floor only. Our room at the top had great views of the Natural History museum, and was pleasantly quiet and free from traffic noise. Our room had ample storage and hanging space for our evening wear (we were going to an evening 'black tie' function), and would have been ok for storing several days' worth of clothing. The room was equipped with a safe which worked perfectly, the bathroom had a large shower where one does not get bruises knocking the sides and the normal complimentary toiletries were of good quality, but please, not luxurious as some mentioned! There was ample supply of towels too. There was very efficient air conditioning which kept the room at a comfortable temperature. The bed was a large kingsize which was arguably a tad too large for the room, there was just enough space to move from one side to the other one person at a time! But this is London after all, and the property is a grand old house where all rooms were former residences, and it is normal to expect a huge variation in the size and shapes of those rooms. The bland all rooms the same the world over of large hotel chains it ain't. We found the bed ultra comfortable, but the bedding was a little too warm (big fluffy duvet) for the time of the year. A lighter version would have been perfect. The duvet was a little on the small side for the size of the bed, too, but we did not find this a problem as we spent most of our night above the covers rather than under as it was too warm to stay under! The standard of the decoration was simple, neutral, but spotless. The carpet was very clean, we did not find one stain on it. The room smelled fresh and inviting, and the free bottle water was welcome after a long and sweaty train and tube journey. We loved the snug bar/coffee lounge by the reception. We ordered a nice bottle of wine, and sipped away at it for a while reading the papers. Coffee and tea was very good too, and free all day. The wine was very reasonably priced at £15 a bottle, which we thought was also cheap for London. The continental breakfast bar was ample for our needs. Finally, we paid what we were quoted, and the staff was courteous, helpful without being intrusive. The night porter was opening the door for us when we returned very late even before we had rung the bell! We would certainly return to this hotel for short stays in London, it is one of the best finds we have made in a long time. The access to the West end is excellent, and the location is great, the hotel is comfortable without pretence, and the staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the White Wine Taster Evenings!!!!”
Reviews.Author: leem123
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a hidden gem right in the heart of London's musuems and hyde park. It had a very clean and trendy feel to the place, felt like home in California. Grand townhouse split into sections. The customer service was absolutely amazing! These guys Mohamed and Thomas was amazing, made the breakfast atmosphere a pleasureable experience. Reception was a little discreet, so it did confuse us. We booked a double room with a bath, facing the back. I have to say the view of a historial mews was a pleasure to see. In the evening they had a white wine taster session complimentary and the following wine at a amazing £5.00 a glass the best Chenin Blanc I have tasted for a longtime.
